selected_quotes: When does a country no longer need a vaccine? An eradication elimination explainer #vaccineswork @C…
Food for thought for those discussing #vaccines at #CDC2017 #publichealth
We've only globally eradicated one disease, so why do we not vaccinate for every other one that still exists?
In Australia we still vaccinate against polio, but not tuberculosis. Why, and how do we decide?
When is an infectious disease no longer dangerous? #OutsmartEpidemics

citation.abstract: Vaccinating against an infectious disease can stop once the threat of future transmission is deemed sufficiently low.
